issues.description: The problem statement and task descriptions refer to the class as "ExcellencePark", whereas both the template and solution repositories use the class name "ExcellenceLand". This mismatch will prevent students from finding or implementing the specified class and cause test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename the class (and file) in the template and solution from ExcellenceLand to ExcellencePark to match the problem statement, or update the problem statement and task descriptions to refer to ExcellenceLand consistently.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to the main park class as `ExcellencePark`, but both the template and solution code use `ExcellenceLand`. Students will be unable to map the required `ExcellencePark` entity to the provided `ExcellenceLand` class.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in the template and solution from `ExcellenceLand` to `ExcellencePark`, or update the problem statement to refer to `ExcellenceLand`, ensuring the same name is used across all artifacts.
